highlights.title: Anthropic, Infosys to Build Custom AI Agents for Firms
highlights.description: Anthropic PBC has partnered Indian technology firm Infosys Ltd. to develop advanced artificial intelligence solutions for companies across sectors including telecommunications and financial services.

highlights.title: Adani Plans to Invest $100 Billion in AI Data Centers by 2035
highlights.description: Adani Group plans to invest $100 billion by 2035 to develop green-powered, AI-ready data centers as billionaire Gautam Adani seeks to capitalize on India’s emergence as a hub for artificial intelligence and cloud computing.

highlights.title: The Small English Town Swept Up in the Global AI Arms Race
highlights.description: The residents of Potters Bar are working to protect the “green belt” of farms, forests, and meadows that surround London from the endless demand for AI infrastructure.

highlights.title: China AI Startup Moonshot Targets $10 Billion Valuation
highlights.description: Moonshot is targeting a valuation of $10 billion in an expansion of a funding round already backed by Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. and Tencent Holdings Ltd., seeking to tap strong interest in Chinese startups creating AI models to rival Silicon Valley’s best.

highlights.title: iOS 26.4 Lays Groundwork for CarPlay Video, Including Apple TV
highlights.description:
Back at WWDC 2025, Apple revealed that it was planning to allow CarPlay users to watch video via AirPlay in their vehicles while they are not driving, and the first beta of iOS 26.4 suggests the feature may be nearing availability.


The original mention of the feature appeared on Apple's CarPlay page for developers within a section specific to automakers, indicating that CarPlay with AirPlay video is something automakers will need to implement with on their end. Presumably, this is because there needs to be integration with vehicle systems to ensure that the feature can only be used while the vehicle is parked so as to hinder the potential for distracted driving.

The first iOS 26.4 beta seeded to developers today includes a number of new references to ‌CarPlay‌ video playback, including features like onboarding flows, notifications, and more.

Apple TV will likely support the ‌CarPlay‌ video feature when it launches, as there are additional references to interacting with the TV app while using ‌CarPlay‌, such as a message that would pop up informing users that they will need to subscribe to ‌Apple TV‌ on their iPhone while not driving if they attempt to access subscription content.

Related Roundup: CarPlay
Related Forum: HomePod, HomeKit, CarPlay, Home & Auto Technology
This article, "iOS 26.4 Lays Groundwork for CarPlay Video, Including Apple TV" first appeared on MacRumors.com
Discuss this article in our forums

highlights.title: Murata President on AI Demand, Chips Shortages
highlights.description: Speaking to Bloomberg's Shery Ahn in Kyoto, President Norio Nakajima expects strong AI demand for the next 3 years and also noted that while memory chip shortages are beginning to squeeze output in the low-end sector, the high-end segment remains resilient. (Source: Bloomberg)

highlights.title: Modi Seizes AI Summit to Assert India’s Global Ambitions After Tough Year
highlights.description: Six months ago, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi was fending off verbal attacks from US President Donald Trump, trying to regain the upper hand over Pakistan after an armed conflict, and facing questions about his economy’s prospects.
